🎓 Honored to share our graduation project–Homely  💻🌍Over the past few months, my team and I developed Homely, a web-based platform designed to support expatriates and newcomers as they navigate life in a new city — from discovering food options to accessing laundry services and exploring available workspaces and gyms.🔧 Technology used:Backend:•ASP.NET Core Web API•ASP.NET Identity for user and role management•JWT for secure, role-based authentication•SignalR for real-time notifications•SQL Server for data storageFrontend:•HTML,CSS,JavaScript🚀 Key Features: • Ordering from local food providers• Access to public laundry services• Informational access to workspaces and gyms• Secure role-based login using ASP.NET Identity + JWTDeveloped in collaboration with:Team Back (Backend Development):  Aya Essam (myself), Basant Elsherif ,Sarah Medhat Team Front (Frontend Development):Juliana Ashraf ,Jolly Tadros ,Marina Sherif ,Maria Wagih My contributions focused on backend development, including API architecture, implementing secure authentication using JWT, and real-time functionality using SignalR.🏆 We are proud to have been awarded an A+ grade for this project a reflection of the dedication, technical depth, and teamwork behind Homely.📽️ Attached is a short demo of the web application. I'd be happy to hear your feedback or answer any questions!📩 I'm currently open to opportunities in backend development.Feel free to connect if you're hiring or simply open to networking!hashtag#GraduationProject hashtag#Homely hashtag#WebApp hashtag#ASPNetCore hashtag#JWTAuthentication hashtag#SignalR hashtag#DotNet hashtag#SQLServer hashtag#TeamBack hashtag#TeamFront hashtag#BackendDevelopment hashtag#FullStackDevelopment hashtag#WomenInTech hashtag#OpenToWork hashtag#TechForGood hashtag#WebDevelopment hashtag#FinalYearProject
